question: What was the reason for the year-on-year increase in Compute & Networking revenue?
answer: The year-on-year increase in Compute & Networking revenue was due to higher Data Center revenue. Compute grew 266% due to higher shipments of the NVIDIA Hopper GPU computing platform for the training and inference of LLMs, recommendation engines and generative AI applications. Networking was up 133% due to higher shipments of InfiniBand.

question: What was the reason for the year-on-year increase in Graphics revenue?
answer: The year-on-year increase in Graphics revenue was led by growth in Gaming of 15% driven by higher sell-in to partners following the normalization of channel inventory levels.

question: What was the reason for the year-on-year increase in Reportable segment operating income for Compute & Networking and Graphics?
answer: The year-on-year increase in Compute & Networking and Graphics operating income was driven by higher revenue.

question: What was the reason for the year-on-year decrease in All Other operating loss?
answer: The year-on-year decrease in All Other operating loss was due to the $1.4 billion Arm acquisition termination cost in fiscal year 2023, partially offset by a $839 million increase in stock-based compensation expense in fiscal year 2024.

question: What was the concentration of revenue for sales to customers outside of the United States for fiscal years 2024 and 2023?
answer: Revenue from sales to customers outside of the United States accounted for 56% and 69% of total revenue for fiscal years 2024 and 2023, respectively.
